落し: (おとし) - dropping/losing; missing item/something one forgot to write down; trap; wooden protrusion from a Japanese door frame that fits a hole in the threshold, acting as a lock when closed; conclusion (of a speech, etc.); metallic bowl used to hold the charcoal in a wooden hibachi
落しどころ: (おとしどころ) - point of compromise; common ground
落し主: (おとしぬし) - loser; owner of a lost article
落し入れる: (おとしいれる) - to trick someone into (committing a crime, etc.)/to hatch a plan and deceive someone; to assault (a castle, etc.); to drop something and have it fall into something
落し前: (おとしまえ) - money paid to settle a fight
落し子: (おとしご) - nobleman's illegitimate child; evil consequence
